title.en: Prayer of the View, Meditation and Conduct

text.en: The primordial ground, the great, ever-pure primordial emptiness,
Which is free from all elaboration and change,
text.en-trans: yé né zhir dzok pogyur trö kündral

text.en: Is the very nature of uncompounded and self-arising awareness:
Bless me so that I may recognize the view, my very own nature.
text.en-trans: tawa rang ngotrö par jingyi lob

text.en: To meditate without distraction in this uncontrived expanse,
text.en-trans: machö long der ma yeng ngang gom gyi

text.en: Which has neither contraction nor expansion, is simply to settle,
text.en-trans: mi tro mi du sam jödral bar zhak

text.en: Without thought or expression, in natural awareness – the three kāyas:
text.en-trans: ku sum lhündrub rigpé shi luk der

text.en: Bless me so that I may meditate like this, with decisiveness and ease.
text.en-trans: takchö lo dejung bar jingyi lob

text.en: All thoughts of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are unbound and naturally liberated,
And there is no need for effort-based antidotes
text.en-trans: ma ching rangdrol nyenpö tsolmé par

text.en: In this, the great, primordial liberation beyond adoption and rejection:
text.en-trans: panglang lé dé yedrol chenpö ngang

text.en: Bless me so that I may realize this great, all-encompassing liberation upon arising.
The supremely secret view, meditation, conduct and result of the Great Perfection
Are to be realized through the guru’s kindness,
text.en-trans: ta gom chö dré lamé drin gyi tok

text.en: And the devotion of one’s own awareness arising as the guru:
Bless me so that your inspiration and blessings may enter my heart.
text.en-trans: jinlab nying la jukpar jingyi lob
